meanings.definition: To burn the surface of something
meanings.sent1: She was charring the marshmallows over the campfire.
meanings.sent2: The chef was charring the steak on the grill.
meanings.sent3: The kids found charring the edges of their toast to be a fun experiment.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to be charring the earth with its scorching rays.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire was charring everything in its path, leaving a trail of destruction.

meanings.definition: The act of burning the surface of something
meanings.sent1: The charring of the wood gave the cabin a rustic look.
meanings.sent2: The charring on the edges of the paper indicated it had been in a fire.
meanings.sent3: The charring on the toast made it look like a piece of modern art.
meanings.sent4: The charring on the building told the story of the fire that had ravaged it.
meanings.sent5: The charring on the tree trunk revealed the intensity of the lightning strike.
